question: Which of these following statements is wrong about Tacrolimus?

options.opa: It is one of the macrolide antibiotic
options.opb: It can be safely administered with any nephrotoxic drug
options.opc: Glucose intolerance is a well known side effect
options.opd: It is used as prophylaxis for transplant rejection

reasoning_chain: CHAIN: Tacrolimus -> immunosuppressant -> used in organ transplant recipients -> 95% CHAIN: Tacrolimus -> not a macrolide antibiotic -> 90% CHAIN: Tacrolimus -> nephrotoxicity risk -> avoid concomitant use with other nephrotoxic drugs -> 85% CHAIN: Tacrolimus -> glucose intolerance -> known side effect -> 95%
enhanced_information: Tacrolimus is not a macrolide antibiotic, it is used as prophylaxis for transplant rejection, and glucose intolerance is a well-known side effect. It should not be safely administered with any nephrotoxic drug due to its own nephrotoxicity risk. Evidence paths confirm the association of Tacrolimus with glucose intolerance.
analysis: Tacrolimus is not a macrolide antibiotic; it is a calcineurin inhibitor used for transplant rejection. Glucose intolerance is a known side effect of Tacrolimus. Due to its own nephrotoxicity risk, it should not be safely administered with any nephrotoxic drug.
